org.jetel.component.denormalize

Class CTLRecordDenormalize

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jetel.ctl.CTLAbstractTransform
      • org.jetel.component.denormalize.CTLRecordDenormalize
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    RecordDenormalize, Transform

    public abstract class CTLRecordDenormalize
extends CTLAbstractTransform
implements RecordDenormalize
    Base class of all Java transforms generated by CTL-to-Java compiler from CTL transforms in the Denormalizer component.
    See Also:
    RecordDenormalize

    • Field Summary

      Fields

      • init

        public final boolean init(java.util.Properties parameters,
           DataRecordMetadata sourceMetadata,
           DataRecordMetadata targetMetadata)
                   throws ComponentNotReadyException
        Description copied from interface: RecordDenormalize
        Initializes normalize class/function. This method is called only once at the beginning of normalization process. Any object allocation/initialization should happen here.
        Specified by:
        init in interface RecordDenormalize
        Parameters:
        parameters - Global graph parameters and parameters defined specially for the component which calls this transformation class
        sourceMetadata - Metadata describing source data records
        targetMetadata - Metadata describing target data record
        Returns:
        true if OK, otherwise false
        Throws:
        ComponentNotReadyException

      • initDelegate

        protected java.lang.Boolean initDelegate()
                                  throws ComponentNotReadyException
        Called by init(Properties, DataRecordMetadata, DataRecordMetadata) to perform user-specific initialization defined in the CTL transform. The default implementation does nothing, may be overridden by the generated transform class.
        Returns:
        true on success, false otherwise
        Throws:
        ComponentNotReadyException - if the initialization fails

      • append

        public final int append(DataRecord inRecord)
                 throws TransformException
        Description copied from interface: RecordDenormalize
        Passes one input record to the composing class.
        Specified by:
        append in interface RecordDenormalize
        Returns:
        < -1 -- fatal error / user defined -1 -- error / skip record >= 0 -- OK
        Throws:
        TransformException

      • appendDelegate

        protected abstract java.lang.Integer appendDelegate()
                                             throws ComponentNotReadyException,
                                                    TransformException
        Called by append(DataRecord) to append data record in a user-specific way defined in the CTL transform. Has to be overridden by the generated transform class.
        Throws:
        ComponentNotReadyException - if some internal initialization failed
        TransformException - if an error occurred

      • appendOnError

        public final int appendOnError(java.lang.Exception exception,
                DataRecord inRecord)
                        throws TransformException
        Description copied from interface: RecordDenormalize
        Passes one input record to the composing class. Called only if RecordDenormalize.append(DataRecord) throws an exception.
        Specified by:
        appendOnError in interface RecordDenormalize
        Parameters:
        exception - an exception that caused RecordDenormalize.append(DataRecord) to fail
        Returns:
        < -1 -- fatal error / user defined -1 -- error / skip record >= 0 -- OK
        Throws:
        TransformException

      • appendOnErrorDelegate

        protected java.lang.Integer appendOnErrorDelegate(java.lang.String errorMessage,
                                      java.lang.String stackTrace)
                                           throws ComponentNotReadyException,
                                                  TransformException
        Called by appendOnError(Exception, DataRecord) to append data record in a user-specific way defined in the CTL transform. May be overridden by the generated transform class. Throws UnsupportedOperationException by default.
        Parameters:
        errorMessage - an error message of the error message that occurred
        stackTrace - a stack trace of the error message that occurred
        Throws:
        ComponentNotReadyException - if some internal initialization failed
        TransformException - if an error occurred

        TransformException - if an error occurred
